byline.contributor: Suhasini Raj and Hari Kumar contributed reporting.

abstract: Indian negotiators at Paris climate talks try to balance their country's need for economic development with reducing particularly severe effects of global warming there; maintain developing economies should not be obligated to alleviate problem they did not cause.
lead_paragraph: Despite a range of environmental crises and health hazards, raising a vast population out of poverty remains a higher national priority in India than global warming.

headline.main: For Indians, Smog and Poverty Are Higher Priorities Than Talks in Paris
headline.print_headline: For Indians, Smog and Poverty Are Higher Priorities Than Talks in Paris

snippet: Despite a range of environmental crises and health hazards, raising a vast population out of poverty remains a higher national priority in India than global warming.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
